hw_pmhal_bgap_common_data.c File Reference

Band gap Temperature Sensor data common between tda2xx and tda3xx is defined in this file. The temperature to ADC conversion is also defined here. More...

#include <stdint.h>
#include <stddef.h>
#include "pmhal_bgap.h"
#include "hw_pmhal_bgap_data.h"

 Returns the pointer to the temperature range for the given ADC value read from the register. More...

 Returns the pointer to the temperature range for the given ADC value read from the register. More...
 

Variables

const pmhalBgapRange_t gPmhalBgapAdcMap [PMHAL_BGAP_TOTAL_ADC_SUPPORTED]
 Global LUT which maps the ADC to the temperature mapping. The two fields here give the minimum and maximum temperatures indicated by the ADC value. The LUT is indexed using the ADC value read as an index. The temperature values listed are in milli degree Celsius. More...
 

Detailed Description

Band gap Temperature Sensor data common between tda2xx and tda3xx is defined in this file. The temperature to ADC conversion is also defined here.

Function Documentation

uint32_t PmhalBgapGetAdcValue ( int32_t  tempInMilliDegree)

Returns the pointer to the temperature range for the given ADC value read from the register.

Parameters
tempInMilliDegreeTemperature in milli degree Celsius.
Returns
adcValue Corresponding ADC Value read for a valid temperature 0 - If the temperature range is not supported.
const pmhalBgapRange_t* PmhalBgapGetTemperatureRange ( uint32_t  adcValue)

Returns the pointer to the temperature range for the given ADC value read from the register.

Parameters
adcValueADC Value read from the register.
Returns
currTempRange Pointer to the temperature range as stored in the LUT. NULL if ADC value is not in the supported range.

Variable Documentation

const pmhalBgapRange_t gPmhalBgapAdcMap[PMHAL_BGAP_TOTAL_ADC_SUPPORTED]

Global LUT which maps the ADC to the temperature mapping. The two fields here give the minimum and maximum temperatures indicated by the ADC value. The LUT is indexed using the ADC value read as an index. The temperature values listed are in milli degree Celsius.
